entry.title: Spirit Halloween The Movie (2022) Review - Monster Madness

media:group.media:title: Spirit Halloween The Movie (2022) Review - Monster Madness
media:group.media:description:
I just love those Spirit Halloween stores, there was nothing like this when I was a kid. Now, every season, they pop up, just kind of appear out of nowhere... like a spirit. Well what if all of the costumes and animatronics inside it came to life? What if you were locked in a Spirit Halloween and things started attacking? Well it’s now a movie. It’s a perfect concept, but is the execution as good as the idea? Let’s take a look.
Follow James: https://twitter.com/cinemassacre
For everything else Cinemassacre: https://cinemassacre.com/
#SpiritHalloween #MonsterMadness

entry.title: Werewolf by Night (2022) Review - Monster Madness

media:group.media:title: Werewolf by Night (2022) Review - Monster Madness
media:group.media:description:
Pick up your copy of Alfred Hitchcock - Vertigo now: https://bit.ly/VertigoUS
Marvel recently put out a surprise Halloween special Werewolf by Night on Disney Plus. Based off of the classic horror comics, it's presented in black and white and has the cozy feeling of an old Universal Monster monster movie. I liked it, but was taken aback a little because it wasn't exactly what I was expecting. So let's get into it!

Today I'm talking about Halloween Ends, the final chapter in the new Halloween trilogy. Directed by David Gordon Green, Jamie Lee Curtis and Michael Myers go at it for the last time. So, how does Halloween “END”? Is it the fulfilling conclusion that we needed? Or does it end in the toilet... you don’t wanna know. But if you do, here’s what I think at least.

entry.title: My Tribute to Roger Corman: The King of B Movies - Monster Madness

media:group.media:title: My Tribute to Roger Corman: The King of B Movies - Monster Madness
media:group.media:description:
Thanks to Bespoke Post for sponsoring this video! New subscribers get 20% off their first box — go to https://bespokepost.com/cinemassacre20 and enter code CINEMASSACRE20 at checkout.
Today I want to celebrate Roger Corman, one of those most prolific filmmakers of all time. Few people have made as many films as Roger Corman and when you think low budget exploitation film, he’s the king. So today we honor the king! Director of over 50 movies and producer of more than another 500, Roger Corman has contributed so much to the film industry and is someone I think more people in the mainstream should know about.
Follow James: https://twitter.com/cinemassacre
For everything else Cinemassacre: https://cinemassacre.com/
#rogercorman #monstermadness #cinemassacre #jamesrolfe

This October I’m taking a look at some of the newest horror films that are streaming, rather than just looking at old stuff. Today we’re talking about a YouTuber in a haunted house who’s doing a livestream, except it turns into a Deadstream! It just came out on Shudder, here’s what I thought about it.
Starring Joseph Winter, who also wrote and directed the film along with his wife Vanessa Winter.

entry.title: Halloween (1978) The Movies Within the Movie - Monster Madness

media:group.media:title: Halloween (1978) The Movies Within the Movie - Monster Madness
media:group.media:description:
Every October, it's a tradition to watch the original John Carpenter's Halloween, but what about the horror movies the characters are watching in Halloween? It's a familiar trope, the movie within the movie, something to compliment what's actually happening in the film. It could be a tribute to the movies the director grew up, but could there be more of a reason why these movies are on the TV? Is there a reason why Carpenter chose The Thing (1951), Forbidden Planet, and Night of the Living Dead specifically, or, was it all at random? That's what I'm investigating today!
Follow James: https://twitter.com/cinemassacre
For everything else Cinemassacre: https://cinemassacre.com/
#Halloween #Halloween1978 #JohnCarpenter #JamesRolfe

entry.title: Rob Zombie's The Munsters (2022) Review - Monster Madness

media:group.media:title: Rob Zombie's The Munsters (2022) Review - Monster Madness
media:group.media:description:
It’s time to get into the spirit of Halloween and Monster Madness or “Munster” Madness today. Every October, I like to do something a little different. This time I’ll be checking out some NEW horror and monster movies. And by NEW I mean, they just came out! This is exciting for me, because it gives me an excuse to watch brand new stuff, instead of always just going into my familiar rolodex, digging into classic horror and things from the past. Which I enjoy and will continue to do, but today’s pick is equally nostalgic as its a reboot of the classic 60s show by Rob Zombie, The Munsters!
Follow James: https://twitter.com/cinemassacre
For everything else Cinemassacre: https://cinemassacre.com/
#TheMunsters #RobZombie #JamesRolfe #MonsterMadness

entry.title: What Happened to Saturday Morning Cartoons?

media:group.media:title: What Happened to Saturday Morning Cartoons?
media:group.media:description:
Remember Saturday Morning Cartoons? From the 60s until the 90s, the 3 big TV networks, ABC, CBS and NBC would show a block of cartoons every Saturday, generally from 8am till Noon or 1, give or take. So let’s look back at this tradition to remember a bunch of shows I used to watch. We’ll talk about the reasons for the decline, and how I feel about it today.
Follow James: https://twitter.com/cinemassacre
For everything else Cinemassacre: https://cinemassacre.com/
#JamesRolfe #SaturdayMorningCartoons #TVReview

media:group.media:title: Is Avatar (2009) Overrated?
media:group.media:description:
Avatar 2 is coming out this year so I decided to rewatch the first one and see how it holds up. I remember really loving it in the theaters, but I felt very outnumbered by the lackluster response. It seemed to me, from what I heard from friends and the internet in general, is that most people didn’t like it very much. Why have I heard nothing but negative stuff about this film? If its so bad, why is it getting a sequel? People say it's "overrated", so let's investigate.
Directed by James Cameron, Avatar (2009) stars Sam Worthington as Jake Sully and Zoe Saldana as Neytiri a Na'vi Warrior. Also starring Sigourney Weaver, Stephen Lang, Michelle Rodriguez, and Giovanni Ribisi.
Follow James: https://twitter.com/cinemassacre
For everything else Cinemassacre: https://cinemassacre.com/
#Avatar #Avatar2 #JamesRolfe #Cinemassacre

entry.title: Hudson Hawk (NES) - Angry Video Game Nerd (AVGN)

media:group.media:title: Hudson Hawk (NES) - Angry Video Game Nerd (AVGN)
media:group.media:description:
Go to https://expressvpn.com/cinemassacre and find out how you can get 3 months of ExpressVPN free!
This is episode 204 of the Angry Video Game Nerd (AVGN)! When it comes to movie-based games, you’d think The Nerd covered them all by now, but here’s another one based on the Bruce Willis film, Hudson Hawk on NES. The movie is a bit of a mixed bag, so lets see what kind of "bag' the game is! Released by Sony Imagesoft in 1991 for the Nintendo Entertainment System, you play as the titular Hudson Hawk (Willis), the world's greatest thief, who is forced to steal three of Da Vinci's precious artifacts by the Mario Brothers Mafia. The movie also starred Danny Aiello, Andie MacDowell, Richard E. Grant, and Sandra Bernhard.
Written and Directed by James Rolfe: https://twitter.com/cinemassacre
Filmed and Edited by Kieran Fallon, check out their Twitch stream: https://www.twitch.tv/kieeeeern
For everything else Cinemassacre: https://cinemassacre.com/

entry.title: Rocky Climbed a Mountain (Rocky IV filming locations)

media:group.media:title: Rocky Climbed a Mountain (Rocky IV filming locations)
media:group.media:description:
Have you ever wondered where the training scenes from Rocky IV were filmed at? I made the journey, matching up shots and doing my best to get as close as possible to some of the more elusive (and dangerous) locations that Sylvester Stallone bravely conquered as Rocky Balboa in his quest to become strong enough to defeat the human monster Ivan Drago.
A documentary by James Rolfe
Camera operator and assistant Derek Wayne Johnson https://www.instagram.com/dwjohnson16/?hl=en https://twitter.com/dwjohnson16?lang=en
Covers by Epic Game Music. (and Rex Viper) https://www.youtube.com/epicgamemusic
Vocals by James Harding. https://villainest.bandcamp.com/
Library Music by Partners in Rhyme, Fresh Music and Epidemic Music.
Archival climbing footage by: Tristan Greszko https://vimeo.com/86849714 Jeff Prashaw https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aslkvYumZ24
Follow James: https://twitter.com/cinemassacre
For everything else Cinemassacre: https://cinemassacre.com/

entry.title: My Tribute to the King of Comedy Spoofs - Mel Brooks

media:group.media:title: My Tribute to the King of Comedy Spoofs - Mel Brooks
media:group.media:description:
Go to https://upstart.com/cinemassacre to check your rate today!
I always liked funny movies, but there was a time when there existed a level ABOVE funny. Movies that were outrageous. The king of that genre was Mel Brooks. He's influenced so much of our humor today and I recently read his memoir "All About Me", so I figured it's about time for Cinemassacre to pay tribute to him!
Follow James: https://twitter.com/cinemassacre
For everything else Cinemassacre: https://cinemassacre.com/
